semantics.ranking

Class RankingFunction<I extends Interpretable>

  • Object
    • RankingFunction<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - Interpretable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExplainedRankingFunction, RelationalRankingFunction

    public class RankingFunction<I extends Interpretable>
extends Object
    A ranking function provides semantics to qualitative conditionals. Each possible world is mapped to a rank, a positive integer describing its plausibility, with 0 given to a most plausible world.
    Author:
    Tobias Falke

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int INFINITY
      Value used to denote infinity
      protected Map<Interpretation<I>,Integer> ranking
      Mapping of worlds to ranks
      protected Interpretation<I>[] worlds
      Possible worlds

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RankingFunction(Interpretation<I>[] worlds)
      Creates a new ranking function for the given set of worlds, initially mapping each world to 0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accepts(Collection<Conditional<I>> conditionals)
      Determines whether a set of conditionals is accepted by the ranking function, which is the case if all conditionals are accepted by the ranking function.

      Determines whether the given conditional is accepted by the ranking function, which is the case if the conditionals verification has a lower rank than its falsification.
      boolean accepts(Formula<I> f)
      Determines whether a formula is accepted, which is the case if it is satisfied in all worlds ranked most plausible, i.e.

      Returns the rank of the conditional's falsification formula, i.e.
      int getRank(Conditional<I> c)
      Returns the rank for a conditional, which is the difference between the rank of its verification and the rank of its antecedence.
      int getRank(Formula<I> f)
      Returns the rank for a formula, which is the minimal rank of all worlds in which the formula is satisfied, or INFINITY, if there is no such world.

      Returns the rank assigned to the given world.

    • Method Detail

      • accepts

        public boolean accepts(Collection<Conditional<I>> conditionals)
        Determines whether a set of conditionals is accepted by the ranking function, which is the case if all conditionals are accepted by the ranking function.
        Parameters:
        conditionals - Set of conditionals
        Returns:
        true, if all conditionals are accepted, false otherwise

      • accepts

        public boolean accepts(Conditional<I> c)
        Determines whether the given conditional is accepted by the ranking function, which is the case if the conditionals verification has a lower rank than its falsification.
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        true, if it is accepted, false otherwise

      • accepts

        public boolean accepts(Formula<I> f)
        Determines whether a formula is accepted, which is the case if it is satisfied in all worlds ranked most plausible, i.e. with 0.
        Parameters:
        f - Formula
        Returns:
        true, if it is accepted, false otherwise

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object other)
        Checks whether the ranking functions are equal, i.e. if they are defined on the same set of possible worlds and assign the same ranks to them.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - Other ranking function
        Returns:
        true, if they are equal, false otherwise

      • falsifies

        public boolean falsifies(Interpretation<I> world,
                Conditional<I> c)
        Checks whether the given conditional is falsified in the given world.
        Parameters:
        world - World
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        true, if the conditional is falsified, false otherwise

      • getFalsificationFormula

        protected Formula<I> getFalsificationFormula(Conditional<I> c)
        Returns the formula to test the falsification of a conditional, i.e. A!B for (B|A).
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        Falsification formula

      • getFalsificationRank

        public int getFalsificationRank(Conditional<I> c)
        Returns the rank of the conditional's falsification formula, i.e. the rank of the formula A!B for conditional (B|A).
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        Rank

      • getRank

        public int getRank(Conditional<I> c)
        Returns the rank for a conditional, which is the difference between the rank of its verification and the rank of its antecedence. If the verification is ranked with INFINITY, it is also the result.
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        Rank

      • getRank

        public int getRank(Formula<I> f)
        Returns the rank for a formula, which is the minimal rank of all worlds in which the formula is satisfied, or INFINITY, if there is no such world.
        Parameters:
        f - Formula
        Returns:
        Rank

      • getRank

        public int getRank(Interpretation<I> world)
        Returns the rank assigned to the given world.
        Parameters:
        world - Possible world
        Returns:
        Rank

      • getVerificationFormula

        protected Formula<I> getVerificationFormula(Conditional<I> c)
        Returns the formula to test the verification of a conditional, i.e. AB for (B|A).
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        Falsification formula

      • getVerificationRank

        public int getVerificationRank(Conditional<I> c)
        Returns the rank of the conditional's verification formula, i.e. the rank of formula AB for conditional (B|A).
        Parameters:
        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        Rank

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a textual representation for this ranking function, listing every possible world with its rank.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        Textual representation

      • toStringSorted

        public String toStringSorted()
        Returns a textual representation for this ranking function, listing every possible world with its rank, unless it is INFINITY. The worlds are sorted by ranks.
        Returns:
        Textual representation

      • verifies

        Checks whether the given conditional is verified in the given world.
        Parameters:

        c - Conditional
        Returns:
        true, if the conditional is verified, false otherwise
